H0.text: The Moon has a smaller surface area than Earth, so less force is required to launch a spaceship from the surface of the Moon than to launch an identical ship from the surface of Earth.

H1.text: The mass of an object on Earth is greater than on the Moon, so less force is required to launch a spaceship from the Moon than from the Earth.

H2.text: The gravitational field of the Moon is less than that of Earth, so less force is required to launch an identical spaceship from the Moon’s surface than from Earth's surface.

H3.text: The atmosphere of the Moon is much thinner than that of Earth, which is why less force is required to launch a spaceship from the Moon than from Earth.

A4.text: The acceleration due to gravity on the surface of the Moon is approximately 1.625 m/s2, about 16.6% that on Earth's surface or 0.166 ɡ.

A5.text: Because weight is directly dependent upon gravitational acceleration, things on the Moon will weigh only 16.6% (= 1/6) of what they weigh on the Earth.
